revised_title: An Investigation into the Composition and Physiological Effects of Black-Damp in Coal Mines
tldr: This study investigates the composition and physiological effects of black-damp, a dangerous gas found in coal mines. The author analyzes samples from two coal mines and concludes that black-damp is primarily composed of nitrogen, with lower levels of carbonic acid and methane. Inhaling black-damp causes respiratory distress and suffocation, highlighting the importance of proper mine ventilation and safety measures.
